titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I went to S. Paul's for Mattins, & to hear the Bishop of Exeter preach. The verger placed me conspicuously in the Archdeacon's stall, where I was exposed to the view of the congregation. I received the Holy Communion.
After lunch, as I sate by the fire with the Archdeacon,
"Fish Cecil" came in to make his peace with me. I was not very placable
Then Ella and I walked to West
, where she went to make calls, and I to the club. There I exchanged a few words with Lord Bryce.
